SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

xxl.core.relational.query.expressions
Class Aggregates

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.query.expressions.Aggregates

public class Aggregates
extends Object

This class provides static methods for creating ready to use instances of an aggregate node in a directed acyclic graph. Beside these methods, it contains constants for identifying local metadata fragments inside an expression node's global metadata, methods for accessing them and local metadata factories for updating them.

See Also:
Node

Nested Class Summary
static class Aggregates.Mode
          An enumeration providing the local metadata fragments used in an aggregate's global metadata for identifing the aggregate's mode.
static class Aggregates.Type
          An enumeration providing the local metadata fragments used in an aggregate's global metadata for identifing the aggregate's type.

          A factory method that can be used to transform the XML representation of an aggregate expression into the node itself.

          A factory method that can be used to transform an aggregate expression into its XML representation.

Method Detail

newAggregate

public static final Node newAggregate(Aggregates.Type type,
                                      int numberOfArguments,
                                      Aggregates.Mode mode,
                                      Iterator<Node> arguments)
Creates a new aggregate of the given type and mode that accepts the specified number of arguments and processes the arguments contained by the specified iteration.

Parameters:
type - the type of the expression node that should be returned.
numberOfArguments - the number of arguments the returned expression node should be able to accept.
mode - determines whether this aggregate evaluates all input data or only distinct input data for the computation of its result.
arguments - an iteration over the expression nodes that should be processed by the returned expression node.
Returns:
a new aggragate of the given type and mode that accepts the specified number of arguments and processes the arguments contained by the specified iteration.
